results.firPara: The Brazilian club were in middle of fairytale season after reaching Copa Sudamericana final, having been promoted to the top flight in 2013
results.secPara: Chapecoense, the Brazilian team on board the plane that has crashed in Colombia, were in the middle of a fairytale season before the tragedy struck.
results.webTitle: Tragedy strikes Chapecoense, serial overachievers dubbed a ‘Brazilian Leicester’

results.firPara: A large number of football players around the world live a precarious existence in which contracts are not respected and their control over their career path is minimal, according to a survey carried out by the global players union, Fifpro.
results.secPara: The Fifpro Global Employment Report paints a picture of an industry fraught with instability and, in an alarming number of cases, insufficient regulation, with basic employment standards not being met. Among its findings is 41% of players have experienced delayed salary payments over the last two seasons and the median net monthly income of those surveyed is between $1,000 (£804) and $2,000 a month.
results.webTitle: Low wages, threats, late payment – the life of football’s non-elite players

results.firPara: Gareth Southgate will attempt to persuade his assistant with the England Under-21s, Steve Holland, to join the national coaching staff on a permanent basis as the Football Association prepare to confirm his appointment as senior manager.
results.secPara: Holland has been combining his duties as Southgates No2, both with the junior team and during the latters four-game stint as interim senior manager, with his role as a first-team coach at Chelsea up to now. While the former Crewe manager, who has been with Chelsea in various coaching capacities over the last seven years, believes he can continue to embrace both roles in future, Southgate would prefer him to quit his post with the Premier League leaders and concentrate instead on his position as a permanent member of the England staff.
results.webTitle: Gareth Southgate wants Steve Holland to join England coaching staff permanently

results.firPara: Jürgen Klopp has said Liverpool will cope without Philippe Coutinho and the Brazilians absence is no excuse for his teams form to falter.
results.secPara: Liverpools influential No10 is expected to be sidelined for around five weeks after scans confirmed he suffered ankle ligament damage during Saturdays Premier League win over Sunderland. The 24-year-old will miss the EFL Cup quarter-final against Leeds United on Tuesday evening, possibly seven Premier League matches, including a Merseyside derby at Everton and Manchester Citys visit to Anfield, and may not return until either the weekend of the FA Cup third round or the visit to Manchester United on 15 January.
results.webTitle: Jürgen Klopp insists Liverpool can cope without injured Philippe Coutinho

results.firPara: Rafael Benítez is disappointed Hull City have refused to increase Newcastle Uniteds allocation of 2,400 tickets for their EFL Cup quarter-final at what threatens to be a sparsely populated KCom Stadium on Tuesday night.
results.secPara: All the indications are that Hulls ground will be barely half full, with a crowd of around 13,000 expected for a tie which both sides arguably could do without as they strive to, respectively, remain in the Premier League and return to it.
results.webTitle: Newcastle United manager Rafa Benítez criticises Hull over EFL Cup tickets

results.firPara: The Crystal Palace chairman, Steve Parish, is to speak with Alan Pardew in the next 24 hours as he seeks evidence that the manager has drawn up a clear plan aimed at extricating the team from their dismal six-game losing run.
results.secPara: Parish, who has been supportive of Pardew throughout a difficult year, was keen to allow the dust to settle after the numbing 5-4 defeat at Swansea on Saturday, when the visitors surrendered a 4-3 lead in stoppage time to leave them outside the bottom three only on goal difference.
results.webTitle: Crystal Palace’s Steve Parish set to meet Alan Pardew to discuss future

results.firPara: The Australian says the club level he is playing at is irrelevant to his national team aspirations and he is in no rush to make the step up to the Premier League
results.secPara: The Championship may be the fourth most-watched league in Europe, but received wisdom is that, for a footballers international future, its a black hole. The Premier League, or at least one of Europes premier leagues, is thought of as the place to be in order to further ones ambitions. But for QPR midfielder Massimo Luongo, thats not necessarily the case.
results.webTitle: Massimo Luongo: the Socceroos star doing it for himself at QPR

results.firPara: Barcelona were not beaten, but they were battered in San Sebastián, leaving Luis Enrique to admit it had been a miracle to escape with a point
results.secPara: Barcelona were not beaten, but they were battered in San Sebastián, leaving Luis Enrique to admit it had been a miracle to escape with a point
results.webTitle: Real Sociedad leave Barcelona with more than just food for thought | Sid Lowe

results.firPara: José Mourinho has been charged for improper conduct by the Football Association following the incident during Manchester Uniteds 1-1 draw with West Ham United on Sunday, when the United manager was sent to the stands in the 27th minute after he kicked a water bottle along the touchline.
results.secPara: A month ago, Mark Clattenburg sent off Mourinho for verbal misconduct in the draw with Burnley at Old Trafford, and the latest charge falls well inside the 12-month period during which the FA can take previous incidents into account. The first sending-off was just over a year ago when Mourinho was Chelsea manager – also against West Ham, at Upton Park, when Moss was the referee.
results.webTitle: José Mourinho charged by FA after sending-off for kicking water bottle

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Al Pardiola, Theo Walcott lets it all out, and hair 1-0 ca
results.secPara: In todays Fiver Al Pardiola, Theo Walcott lets it all out, and hair 1-0 ca
results.webTitle: The Fiver | Comical breaches of Palace security
